instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3209: What is 820-3209? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.LP8550: What is LP8550? This is an LED driver responsible for creating the backlight on the LCD screen of Macbooks from 2011 through 2015.
definitions.D9701: What is D9701? diode in the backlight circuit sitting between the BKL_SW pin of the LED driver and backlight output. Very common for via between this and BKL_FB for feedback to blow, causing no boost. Measure continuity between pin 2 of this diode and feedback pin of LED driver if backlight output is PPBUS_G3H with no boost.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - no backlight (no feedback continuity)
threads.message:
I have this <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board that was liquid damaged around the <CHIP>LP8550</CHIP> so I removed the it and replaced it as well as all the components around it.
With the <CHIP>LP8550</CHIP> removed i did a continuity test from the feedback pad to the probe(938) as well as from the probe(938) to pin 2 of L9701 and there was no continuity for either one. Also when I measured the output caps in diode mode it measured 0.40v which I believe means the feedback line is broken

I put a new <CHIP>LP8550</CHIP> on to shove my 36AWG to the feedback ball and run it to the probe(938) but while doing that I ended up ripping the probe point pad. Can I just run the wire from the feedback ball straight to Pin 2 of L9701?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - no backlight (no feedback continuity)
threads.message: Which feedback are we talking about here? Usually it is ball A5 that has the bad trace. If it really is B1/B2 then both those balls will need to be connected. I see no issue with soldering directly to L9701 as long as it goes where it needs to.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - no backlight (no feedback continuity)
threads.message: Sorry. I was referring to the A5 ball.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - no backlight (no feedback continuity)
threads.message: A5 goes to the backlight output, so easiest would be cathode of <DIODE>D9701</DIODE>.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - no backlight (no feedback continuity)
threads.message: Okay thanks. The board is now fixed. You can mark as solved.
